item.title: Not me
item.description: So this is some text not written by Not Me

item.title: Markdown Notes
item.description: Tables You can create tables by assembling a list of words and dividing them with hyphens - (for the first row), and then separating each column with a pipe |: so this First Header | Second Header ------------ | ------------- Content from cell 1 | Content from cell 2 Content in the first column | Content in the second column Renders as this First Header Second Header Content from cell 1 Content from cell 2 Content in the first column Content in the second column shopping list pt 1 allen wrenches gerbil feeders toilet seats electric heaters Trash compactors juice extractor shower rods and water meters shopping list pt 2 Walkie-talkies copper wires safety goggles radial tires shopping list pt 3 BB pellets rubber mallets fans and dehumidifiers shopping list pt 4 Picture hangers paper cutters waffle irons

item.title: Content Info
item.description: Basic help about site Our basic taxonomy comes from the Metadata in our ‘Front Matter’ This page has the following ‘Front Matter’ taxonomy. tags: ["content" , "help" , "taxonomy"] catagories: ["help"] components: ["hugo"] authors: ["walmo"] Our types of taxonomy we are using are based on our configuration file. The contents [“git” , “html”] we add when we create our file. More accurate content in our Metadata will help users navigate the documents contained within the site.

item.title: HTML Based Pages
item.description: {{.Params.Author}} Trying colours You need to do this in html as markdown does not use colours by default. Some Markdown text with Simple blue coloured text. Back to normal text. Now we can highlight in red this is red.   Some Background When the Platform Engineering team was formed there were a number of different processes in place for requesting work from the team. These included: Process/MethodType of requestREAP Process / EPM
